nodes.bodyText:
We can take a look at this later in a separate PR as this has been like this before this PR.
It think the intent of the README is for developers to make changes, build, run and use the java client library locally as a quick start guide. Downloading from artifactory defeats the purpose.

nodes.bodyText: Is it better set the group as 'com.vmware.singleton' ?
Actually, project.group does not matter for this as we are not publishing this artifact anywhere. To minimize the changes, I am reverting this line to the original.
Since you revert the change for group, so this group should be consistent with others.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -33,4 +33,26 @@ How to build and run this sample application
    ```
    java -jar ./build/libs/sample-with-shared-lib-1.0.jar
    ```
-Note: The library jar will be created under "build/libs" directory.
+How to build and run this sample application as a Spring Boot executable jar

nodes.bodyText:
It's just a way in Spring Boot to automatically run some logic after the application context is loaded. There are many ways to do it in Spring (https://reflectoring.io/spring-boot-execute-on-startup/), but we only need one here as an example to run Main.main which triggers all the sample code. Do you prefer any other way?
Also, we do not want to simple specify Main as  the main Manifest 'Start-class' because this does not load and start a Spring Application context, which may not resemble actual real-world scenarios.
